Vertical.title: Likert Scale Block Deep Dive
Vertical.TextBlock:
## Likert Scale Block Deep Dive
This lesson showcases every configuration option available on the `LikertScale` block. Each example uses existing blocks to provide the row content so you can remix these patterns in your own lessons.

### Example 1: Classic Agreement Scale
- Uses the default 5-point agreement scale via the `scale` attribute. - Demonstrates the optional `title` and `description` fields. - Includes a mix of `TextBlock` and `Markdown` statements.

LikertScale.title: Course Feedback
LikertScale.description: Share how much you agree with the following statements about the learning experience.
LikertScale.scale: Strongly disagree,Disagree,Neither agree nor disagree,Agree,Strongly agree
LikertScale.TextBlock: The instructor kept me engaged throughout the lesson.
The course materials helped me understand the topic.
The pacing of the session felt appropriate.
LikertScale.Markdown: The available support resources (office hours, forums, etc.) met my needs.

Vertical.TextBlock:
### Example 2: Custom Options with Alternate Delimiter
- Uses the `options` attribute to define column headers. - Specifies `scaleDelimiter="|"` to split the pipe-separated options string. - Customizes the summary title with `summaryHeading`.

LikertScale.title: Learning Habits
LikertScale.description: How often do these behaviors describe your learning routine?
LikertScale.TextBlock: I practice new concepts on my own time.
I ask questions when I am unsure about the material.
I review feedback from previous assignments.

Vertical.TextBlock:
### Example 3: Numeric Labels and Locked Responses
- Demonstrates the `labels` attribute for numeric scales. - Disables the reset control with `allowReset="false"`. - Keeps the summary visible so learners can confirm their selections.

LikertScale.title: Confidence Check
LikertScale.description: Rate your confidence level for each topic before moving on.
LikertScale.labels: 1 - Not at all confident,2 - Slightly confident,3 - Moderately confident,4 - Very confident,5 - Extremely confident

Vertical.TextBlock:
### Example 4: Read-Only Display Without Summary
- Uses `readOnly="true"` to prevent changes, which is useful for reviewing saved answers. - Hides the selections list with `showSummary="false"` while keeping the table layout visible. - This configuration can be paired with pre-populated Redux state to show final responses.

LikertScale.title: Final Review
LikertScale.description: Your facilitator has locked these selections for review.
LikertScale.scale: Strongly disagree,Disagree,Neither agree nor disagree,Agree,Strongly agree
LikertScale.TextBlock: The lesson objectives were clear and measurable.
I know which tools to use to continue practicing independently.
